```diff
- {{ $posts := where (where .Site.RegularPages &quot;Type&quot; &quot;posts&quot;) &quot;Draft&quot; false }}
+ {{ $allPosts := where (where .Site.RegularPages &quot;Type&quot; &quot;posts&quot;) &quot;Draft&quot; false }}
+ {{ $uniquePosts := slice }}
+ {{ $seenTitles := dict }}
+ {{ range $allPosts }}
+     {{ $title := .Title }}
+     {{ if not (index $seenTitles $title) }}
+         {{ $seenTitles = merge $seenTitles (dict $title true) }}
+         {{ $uniquePosts = $uniquePosts | append . }}
+     {{ end }}
+ {{ end }}
+ {{ $posts := $uniquePosts }}
  &lt;div class=&quot;recent-posts&quot;&gt;
```

Fixing the deduplication logic. Hugo templates don't support mutable dictionaries. Using Hugo's `group` function instead:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: themes/majority/layouts/_default/home.html</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 4, lines removed: 8

```diff
@@ -10,14 +10,10 @@
  {{ if .Site.Params.showRecentPosts }}
  {{ $allPosts := where (where .Site.RegularPages &quot;Type&quot; &quot;posts&quot;) &quot;Draft&quot; false }}
+ {{ $groupedPosts := $allPosts | group &quot;Title&quot; }}
  {{ $uniquePosts := slice }}
- {{ $seenTitles := dict }}
- {{ range $allPosts }}
-     {{ $title := .Title }}
-     {{ if not (index $seenTitles $title) }}
-         {{ $seenTitles = merge $seenTitles (dict $title true) }}
-         {{ $uniquePosts = $uniquePosts | append . }}
-     {{ end }}
+ {{ range $groupedPosts }}
+     {{ $uniquePosts = $uniquePosts | append (index .Pages 0) }}
  {{ end }}
- {{ $posts := $uniquePosts }}
+ {{ $posts := $uniquePosts | sort &quot;Date&quot; &quot;desc&quot; }}
  &lt;div class=&quot;recent-posts&quot;&gt;
      &lt;div class=&quot;container&quot;&gt;
```

Updated the home template to deduplicate posts by title. It:

1. Groups all posts by title
2. Keeps only the first occurrence from each group
3. Sorts by date (descending) to maintain chronological order

This removes duplicates like `independence-is-dead.md`, `independence-is-dead-1.md`, and `independence-is-dead-2.md` from the front page.

Rebuild the site to see the changes. The front page should now show each article only once.

Should I also check other pages (sidebar, list pages) for duplicate posts?

</details>
</tool-use>

---



---


Creating a script to mark all duplicate files as drafts:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="write">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: mark-duplicates-as-draft.ps1</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 49, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,49 @@
- 
+ # Mark duplicate post files (-1, -2, etc.) as drafts
+ # This prevents them from being built and causing path errors
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;Marking duplicate posts as drafts...&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ 
+ $postsDir = &quot;content\posts&quot;
+ $files = Get-ChildItem -Path $postsDir -Filter &quot;*.md&quot; -File
+ 
+ $marked = 0
+ $skipped = 0
+ 
+ foreach ($file in $files) {
+     # Check if filename matches pattern for duplicates (-1, -2, etc.)
+     if ($file.Name -match &#39;-\d+\.md$&#39;) {
+         $content = Get-Content -Path $file.FullName -Raw
+         $originalContent = $content
+         
+         # Check if already marked as draft
+         if ($content -match &#39;draft\s*=\s*true&#39;) {
+             Write-Host &quot;Already draft: $($file.Name)&quot; -ForegroundColor Yellow
+             $skipped++
+             continue
+         }
+         
+         # Replace draft = false with draft = true
+         if ($content -match &#39;draft\s*=\s*false&#39;) {
+             $content = $content -replace &#39;draft\s*=\s*false&#39;, &#39;draft = true&#39;
+         } else {
+             # If no draft field exists, add it after the title or date
+             if ($content -match &#39;(?s)(\+\+\+.*?)(title\s*=\s*&quot;[^&quot;]*&quot;)&#39;) {
+                 $content = $content -replace &#39;(\+\+\+.*?)(title\s*=\s*&quot;[^&quot;]*&quot;)&#39;, &#39;$1$2&#96;ndraft = true&#39;
+             } elseif ($content -match &#39;(?s)(\+\+\+.*?)(date\s*=\s*[^\n]+)&#39;) {
+                 $content = $content -replace &#39;(\+\+\+.*?)(date\s*=\s*[^\n]+)&#39;, &#39;$1$2&#96;ndraft = true&#39;
+             } else {
+                 # If we can&#39;t find a good place, just add it after the opening +++
+                 $content = $content -replace &#39;(\+\+\+)&#39;, &#39;$1&#96;ndraft = true&#39;
+             }
+         }
+         
+         if ($content -ne $originalContent) {
+             Set-Content -Path $file.FullName -Value $content -NoNewline
+             Write-Host &quot;Marked as draft: $($file.Name)&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+             $marked++
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;&#96;nDone! Marked $marked files as drafts, skipped $skipped files.&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="shell" data-tool-name="run_terminal_cmd">
<details><summary>Tool use: **command** • Run command: powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File mark-duplicates-as-draft.ps1</summary>

```bash
powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File mark-duplicates-as-draft.ps1
```

Locate and enable the policy named `Enable Win32 long paths`.<br/><br/>  Alternatively, you can modify the registry:<br/><br/>  1. Press `Win + R`, type `regedit`, and press Enter to open the Registry Editor.<br/><br/>  2. Navigate to `HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\FileSystem`.<br/><br/>  3. Find the `LongPathsEnabled` entry. If it doesn't exist, create a new `DWORD (32-bit)` value with this name.<br/><br/>  4. Set its value to `1`.<br/><br/>  5. Restart your computer for the changes to take effect.<br/><br/>  Please note that modifying the registry can have unintended consequences if done incorrectly. <details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: fix-hugo-ellipsis-issue.md</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 15, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,15 @@
- 
+ # Fixing Hugo Ellipsis Path Issue
+ 
+ The issue is that Hugo is trying to create paths with &quot;...&quot; (ellipsis) from titles, which Windows doesn&#39;t support in directory names.
+ 
+ ## Root Cause
+ Even though we have &#96;slug&#96; fields set correctly, Hugo appears to be generating some paths from titles in certain cases (possibly for alias redirect pages or other generated content).
+ 
+ ## Solution
+ Since all posts with &quot;...&quot; in titles already have explicit &#96;slug&#96; fields set, and the permalink config uses &#96;:slug&#96;, the issue might be:
+ 1. A Hugo bug where it uses title instead of slug in some edge cases
+ 2. Hugo creating pages for something else (taxonomy, categories) that uses titles
+ 
+ ## Quick Fix
+ The simplest solution is to ensure the slug field is properly formatted and comes BEFORE the title in the front matter, so Hugo processes it first.
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

Hugo is generating a path from the title (`its-a-love-story-baby-just-say-yes...`) instead of the slug, even though:
- The slug is set: `slug = "its-a-love-story-baby-just-say-yes"`
- The permalink uses `:slug`: `posts = "/articles/:slug/"`

This likely happens when Hugo creates alias redirect pages or other generated pages. The slug is set correctly and appears before the title, which is correct.

**The real issue**: Hugo may be creating pages (e.g., alias redirects) that use the title instead of the slug in some cases, which is a Hugo behavior.

**Quick fix**: Since the slug is set and the permalink uses `:slug`, this may be a Hugo bug or edge case. Try rebuilding after clearing the `_site` directory, or check if Hugo is creating taxonomy/category pages from titles.

```
&gt; +++
slug = &quot;its-a-love-story-baby-just-say-yes&quot;
title = &quot;It&#39;s a Love Story, Baby just say Yes...&quot;
date = 2023-03-20T22:16:15Z
draft = false
author = &quot;sparkzilla&quot;
categories = [&quot;Commentary&quot;]
aliases = [&quot;/blog/2023/03/20/its-a-love-story-baby-just-say-yes/&quot;]
+++


&lt;p&gt;I asked &lt;a href=&quot;https://openai.com/blog/chatgpt&quot;&gt;Chat-GPT&lt;/a&gt; to write an   
article based on &lt;a
href=&quot;https://twitter.com/themajorityscot/status/1633085699812458501&quot;&gt;a series  
of tweets&lt;/a&gt; I&#39;d written about Wings Over Scotland&#39;s UDI plan. And for good    
measure, I asked it to weave in the titles of Taylor Swift songs. Why not?&lt;/p&gt;  



&lt;p&gt;---&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;Wings Over Scotland recently revealed a plan for a unilateral declaration    
of independence (UDI), which has been taken on wholeheartedly by Ash Regan,     
that can only be described as a fairytale, swirling with magical thinking and   
a total detachment from reality. &lt;/p&gt;



&lt;figure class=&quot;wp-block-image size-large&quot;&gt;&lt;img
src=&quot;images/posts/Wings-UDI-plan.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; class=&quot;wp-image-10110&quot;/&gt;&lt;/figure&gt;  



&lt;p&gt;The plan sings a story we know &lt;em&gt;All Too Well&lt;/em&gt;: A fragile 50%+1        
majority vote in a Scottish or general election, being used by the Scottish     
Government to announce a technical declaration of independence,  demand
negotiations with the UK government, and seek recognition and support from the  
international community under the UN Charter. Alas, a closer examination of     
this plan reveals it to be an Enchanted castle built on the sand of faulty      
promises and false assumptions. It has no &lt;em&gt;Style&lt;/em&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;The 50%+1 majority vote is an arbitrary target, a filled-in &lt;em&gt;Blank        
Space&lt;/em&gt;, that conveniently overlooks the broader electorate. If this
majority were based on a 50% turnout, it would only represent 25% of Scottish   
votersâ€”a rickety foundation for a new nation. Furthermore, the notion of      
declaring independence with almost half of the population against the idea, is  
not a &lt;em&gt;Love Story&lt;/em&gt;. It&#39;s an open invitation to civil unrest, resulting   
in a lot of &lt;em&gt;Bad Blood&lt;/em&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;The Scottish Government&#39;s capacity to declare independence is a pesky        
detail Wings seems to have missed. Sturgeon&#39;s failed Supreme Court challenge    
made it crystal clear that the devolved administration has no constitutional    
powers, rendering any declaration of independence as unlawful as one of Tim     
Rideout&#39;s banknotes. The UK Government, equipped with a manifesto commitment    
and the power to preserve the UK, would likely scoff at negotiations based on   
fake referendum results, leaving Wings &lt;em&gt;Out of the Woods&lt;/em&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;The role of the United Nations in this misguided adventure is also woefully  
misunderstood. The UN is unlikely to act on an unlawful declaration of
independence from a devolved administration. Scotland is not a colony, and its  
citizens are not deprived of human rights. Moreover, the UN primarily serves    
as a platform for chatter, lacking enforcement powers like a tiger without      
teeth, making it unable to compel any state to break itself up. Wings might     
think that &lt;em&gt;The Best Day&lt;/em&gt; lies in UN intervention, but reality suggests  
otherwise.&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;Appealing to the international community is Wings&#39; &lt;em&gt;Wildest Dream&lt;/em&gt;.   
Few countries would willingly dive into another nation&#39;s internal dispute,      
particularly when it is based on an unlawful UDI declaration and a fake
referendum. The thrilling prospect of seeking support from countries like       
Iran, China, and Russia raises eyebrows and is far from ideal, a situation      
where &lt;em&gt;Everything Has Changed&lt;/em&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;Wings&#39; belief that his proposal presents an &quot;uncontestable democratic        
basis&quot; is, ironically, inherently undemocratic and authoritarian, a
&lt;em&gt;Delicate&lt;/em&gt; dance with danger. It is not democratic to use any election   
as a de facto referendum without the consent of those opposed. &lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;A fake referendum and unlawful UDI declaration cannot be used to shatter     
the UK&#39;s territorial, social, economic, and military security, especially       
after a real referendum has already taken place. Wings&#39; attempt to challenge    
this authority is like trying to &lt;em&gt;Catch A Falling Star.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;Wings Over Scotland&#39;s UDI plan is a fantastical fairytale, devoid of any     
basis in reality. The path to independence, if one exists, must be paved with   
pragmatism, legality, and democratic consensus, not magical thinking and a      
blatant disregard for the rule of law. It is time to wave goodbye to this       
misguided adventure, &lt;em&gt;Shake It Off&lt;/em&gt;, and seek out more viable options.   
In the wise words of Taylor Swift, perhaps it&#39;s time for Wings to look in the   
mirror and realise, &lt;em&gt;&quot;I Knew You Were Trouble&quot;&lt;/em&gt; and instead embrace a    
&lt;em&gt;New (Romantics)&lt;/em&gt; approach to finding a solution.&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;With Wings&#39; UDI plan resembling a tangled web of delusion, it is essential   
to remember that in the pursuit of independence, &lt;em&gt;You Need to Calm
Down&lt;/em&gt; and tread a path that respects both the rule of law and the
democratic will of the people. As the enchantment fades, let&#39;s hope a more      
practical, grounded, and consensus-based approach to Scotland&#39;s future
emerges; one that doesn&#39;t involve any more magical thinking, and instead        
focuses on finding a solution that unites rather than divides. After all,       
wouldn&#39;t it be nice if, instead of a fairytale, we could tell the story of a    
united, prosperous Scotland that &lt;em&gt;Begins Again&lt;/em&gt;?&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Mark Devlin is the publisher of The Majority.&lt;/em&gt; &lt;/p&gt;
```

Removed "..." from the titles in the non-draft posts. Since slugs control the URLs, this only changes the displayed title and shouldn't affect functionality.

The duplicate files (`-1.md`, `-2.md`) with "..." are already marked as drafts, so they won't be built.

Rebuild the site; the error should be resolved. Hugo was generating paths from titles in some cases, and removing "..." from the titles prevents Windows path issues.
